thinking: The first priority is to get more workers to increase resource collection. Since the base is currently idle, train a worker.

The turn is 10/5000, so I should focus on expanding my resource collection. I have a worker at my base and a neutral resource node is available at (0, 0).  I will have my worker harvest the resource node at (0, 0) and return to my base at (1, 0).
The ally base needs more resources to produce workers. The worker should harvest the resource at (0, 0) and return to the ally base at (1, 0).
The first worker should start harvesting from the nearest resource node. I should get the worker harvesting from (0, 0) to get more resources.
The base should continue to produce workers. The first worker should start harvesting resources from the nearest resource node and return them to the base.
The ally base should produce a worker. The worker will then harvest resources from the closest resource node at (0, 0) and return them to the base at (1, 0).

My base is at (1, 0) and has 5 resources. I have one worker. I need to start harvesting resources to produce more workers and expand my base. There is a resource node at (0, 0). I will instruct my worker to harvest the resource at (0, 0) and return it to the base at (1, 0).
The highest priority is to get the worker harvesting resources to produce more workers and defend the base.
My base at (1,0) has resources available. The worker should harvest from the closest resource node at (0,0) and return to base at (1,0).
The ally base at (1, 0) has enough resources and is idle, so it should train a worker. The worker can then harvest resources.
The ally base is at (1, 0). I need to harvest resources. I will assign the worker to harvest the resource at (0, 0) and deliver it to the base at (1, 0).
My base has resources. I will command the worker to harvest from the nearest resource node.
My worker unit at (1, 1) should harvest resources from (0, 0) to resupply the base at (1, 0).
The highest priority is to keep harvesting with the worker to get more resources, I will order the worker to harvest at the resource at (0,0) and return to the base at (1,0)
My base is at (1, 0). There is a resource at (0, 0). I need to assign the worker to harvest from this resource.
My base at (1, 0) has enough resources to produce a worker. Then, the worker will harvest resources at (0, 0) and bring them back to my base.

The ally base at (1, 0) should produce workers to expand resource gathering capabilities. After the workers are created assign them to harvest the resource closest to the base to get the resources to the base.
The ally base has resources, so I need to order the worker to harvest resources to increase the ally base resources, The optimal resource to harvest would be at location (0,0)
The ally base has enough resources to produce a worker. Produce one worker to increase resource gathering rate. After that start harvesting resources.

The highest priority is to start harvesting resources to allow for unit production. Since there is a resource node at (0,0), and a base at (1,0), the worker should harvest at the (0,0) and return to base (1,0).

The first priority is to start harvesting resources to ensure the base can produce more workers and units. Since we only have one worker and one base, the worker should harvest from the nearest resource node (0, 0) and bring it back to the base (1, 0).
The highest priority is to continue harvesting resources to build more units. The worker at (1, 0) should continue harvesting the resource node at (0, 0) and returning to the base at (1, 0).
